task.title: Paying an Invoice
task.abstract:
Receipts are created when payment is applied to an invoice. Posting the receipt to the GL creates a transaction record journaling the debit to an Income Account and a credit to Accounts Receivable. The payment terms of an invoice define the schedule type:
Installment- Customers are invoiced on a set schedule, with the total amount due divided equally or by percentage.
Recurring- The customer's credit card or bank account is automatically charged for the total amount of the Sales Order on a set schedule.
Simple- Customers are invoiced the total amount of the Sales Order, due upon the delivery of products/services sold.

step.cmd: Navigate to the Invoice tab in the eBusiness app and identify the invoice to be paid. Click the Apply Payment button.
step.info: Alternatively, enter the invoice number into the Global Search Bar.

step.cmd: Select the Payment Gateway and the Deposit Account. Click the Pay button.
step.info: If applicable, enter the Batch and Memo information.

taskbody.result: The ePayment record is returned displaying the payment transaction details.
